title: CCGS Moytel
text:
CCGH "Moytel" is a <a href="Canadian%20Coast%20Guard">Canadian Coast Guard</a> air cushioned vehicle or <a href="hovercraft">hovercraft</a> and is based at CCG Hovercraft Base <a href="Richmond%2C%20British%20Columbia">Richmond, British Columbia</a>, on <a href="Sea%20Island%20%28British%20Columbia%29">Sea Island</a>. The primary mission of "Moytel" is to provide <a href="search%20and%20rescue">search and rescue</a> services for <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>.
"Moytel" serves as the replacement for on Sea Island, Richmond, British Columbia. The Canadian Coast Guard describes "Moytel" as a "more versatile amphibious vehicle capable of patrolling inland waters" as well as being "a larger [and] more powerful vessel than the CCGS "Penac", [with] a greater range of capabilities and features, including a bow ramp that will enable it to transport supplies such as rescue equipment and vehicles."
"Moytel" is the subject of British television documentary Monster Moves, Series 6 Episode 6
Description.
"Moytel" is long with a <a href="Beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of . The vessel has a <a href="net%20tonnage">net tonnage</a> of 70 tons and the <a href="Hull%20%28watercraft%29">hull</a> is constructed of aluminium. "Moytel" is powered by four <a href="Caterpillar%20Inc.">Caterpillar C32</a> geared <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>s rated at turning two controllable pitch propellers. The vessel is also equipped with <a href="Bow%20thruster">bow and stern thrusters</a>. "Moytel" has a maximum speed of and a range of at an economical speed of . The vessel has a fuel capacity of of <a href="diesel%20fuel">diesel fuel</a> and an endurance of one day. "Moytel" has a complement of six personnel of which two are officers. 
Service history.
"Moytel" was constructed by <a href="Griffon%20Hoverwork">Griffon Hoverworks Ltd</a> and <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launched</a> in 2013. The vessel entered service with the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) in 2014 and <a href="Ship%20registration">registered</a> in <a href="Ottawa">Ottawa</a>, Ontario. The ship's name means "to help each other" in <a href="Halkomelem">Halq'emélem</a>. "Moytel" is based at CCG Hovercraft Base in <a href="Richmond%2C%20British%20Columbia">Richmond</a>, British Columbia and assigned to the CCG's Western Region.
